Key Match Events: Derrick White scored 26 points, including 13 in the fourth quarter, and hit a fadeaway bank-shot dagger to put Boston ahead by eight points with two minutes remaining.
White helped limit Anthony Edwards to just 15 points on 5-of-16 shooting, including 2-for-9 from 3-point range.
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Joe Mazzulla expected Derrick White to step up and fill the void of Jaylen Brown (out with a right shoulder strain)
Post-Match Reflections: Mazzulla praised White's performance, saying he 'played the whole second and the whole fourth and got those possessions where he impacts the game', and that he's 'just big time because he has the ability to impact the game whether heâ€™s heavily, heavily involved on offense or not'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Derrick White's performance helped the Celtics win 118-115 over the Timberwolves
White is averaging career-high averages in points (17.1), rebounds (4.5), blocks (1.2), steals (1.0), and 3-point makes (3.5)
Others: The Celtics needed White to deliver crunch-time scoring, which he did by scoring exactly half of his points (13) in the fourth quarter
White's contributions were much needed on both ends to help fill the void of Jaylen Brown and Joe Mazzulla
